data.title: Delaware State Parks
data.meta_description: Lums Pond State Park is built around the largest freshwater pond in Delaware. The park features excellent camping, fishing, sports facilities, hiking trails, and an unforgettable Go Ape! Treetop Adventure Course
data.text:
Beginner Kayak Program

Saturday, August 17, 2024

9:00 AM

Are you a beginner paddler in need of instruction? Join park staff for a 45-minute program that starts on land with paddling techniques, safety tips, and ends with a short paddling practice on the pond. Open to participants 14 years and older. (With a parent or guardian). $20 per person

Register Online

Add to Calendar 8/17/2024 9:00:00 AM 8/17/2024 10:00:00 AM America/New_York Beginner Kayak Program Are you a beginner paddler in need of instruction? Join park staff for a 45-minute program that starts on land with paddling techniques, safety tips, and ends with a short paddling practice on the pond. Open to participants 14 years and older. (With a parent or guardian). $20 per person Lums Pond

Sunset Kayak Tours

Thursday, August 22, 2024

6:30 PM

Join us for a guided tour of the largest freshwater pond in the state, with the sun setting it is a perfect time for viewing wildlife and taking in the beautiful scenery to unwind. Previous paddling experience is required. Open to participants 14 years and older. (With a parent or guardian). Only tandem kayaks available so program registration is for two paddlers. $35 per kayak. Register online at the link below.

Register Online

Previous paddling experience is required. Open to participants 14 years and older. (With a parent or guardian). Only tandem kayaks available so program registration is for two paddlers. $35 per kayak. Register online at the link below. Lums Pond

Dip-Netting Discoveries

Sunday, August 25, 2024

11:00 AM

Do you want to know what lives in Lums Pond? Come grab a net and find out! Weather permitting. Pre-Registration required by calling 302-368-6989. Free, with paid park admission!

Girl Scouts Love State Parks - Animal Tracking and ID

Saturday, September 14, 2024

10:00 AM

Learn how to identify certain animals by understanding their physical traits and learn different ways to track wildlife.This program will include a short walk for some hands-on experience. Pre-Registration required by calling 302-368-6989. Free, with paid park admission!

Pre-Registration required by calling 302-368-6989. Free, with paid park admission! Lums Pond

Reptile Hour!

Saturday, November 9, 2024

11:00 AM

Join a naturalist to learn about the reptiles in the park and meet some of the nature center reptiles up close and learn how we care for them. We will also do a fun reptile related craft to take home! Pre-Registration required by calling 302-368-6989. Free, with paid park admission!

Add to Calendar 11/9/2024 11:00:00 AM 11/9/2024 12:00:00 PM America/New_York Reptile Hour! Join a naturalist to learn about the reptiles in the park and meet some of the nature center reptiles up close and learn how we care for them. We will also do a fun reptile related craft to take home! Pre-Registration required by calling 302-368-6989. Free, with paid park admission! Lums Pond

Sunday Stories

Sunday, November 17, 2024

1:00 PM

Come join us at the nature center for a fun filled Stories with a Naturalist program! We will be reading a nature themed book, and creating a take home craft that is related to our book afterwards. Each week will be a different story and craft. Best suited for families with younger children. Pre-Registration required by calling 302-368-6989. Free, with paid park admission!
